His appearance continues to change: clothes, posture, walk, gestures subtly conform to the environment, a bit like Zelig. Throughout the film his appearance shifts, depending on who he's with. We always recognize him, but each time he's different. He walks up to a dealer, makes a quick buy and keeps going. But he sees them and is seen.

direction.raw_text: : TWO WEEKS LATER INT. CRACK HOUSE - DAY Virtual darkness save splinters of light between the curtains. Pipes burn here and there in the gloom. Ten or fifteen crackheads huddle around a battery-operated TV on which Tom Brokaw is narrating an NBC documentary on drugs. A 12-year- old sits against a wall too stoned even for television. Hull approaches Eddie, regally installed on an automobile bench seat-cum-sofa, a lit pipe in one hand. We barely notice the redhead kneeling between his legs, face buried in his crotch. He greets Hull from wrecked bliss. They know each other now.

direction.raw_text: More laughter, etc. Eddie's concentration peaks, breaks off into a sigh and a smile. Eddie sings a satisfied little song... The redhead rises from Eddie's crotch, and we see it's a boy, seventeen going on death; he might have been pretty a year ago. Eddie passes him the crack pipe, lets him suck greedily for a few seconds before ripping it out of his scabrous mouth and offering it to Hull, who, with a grimace that gets laughs, declines. The others continue to watch and comment on the speech.

dialogue.raw_text: You have the right to remain silent... You have the right to an attorney... You have the right to go back to Ontario for eight-to-ten on a second offense...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in several kinds of pain) Oh, man, I can't go back in there, I just can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (soothing) 'Course you can't, child, 'course you can't. That's why you're gonna start giving us some help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A pleasant, Santa Monica neighborhood. Spanish style house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleasant, tasteful. Elias's wife, NANCY, (dressed like the attorney she is) sits in an alcove-study reading a real estate contract through half-glasses. Elias himself is helping his daughter, MIRANDA, 7, with her homework. He is 38, with the body and bearing of a powerful man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias is not a sweet Daddy. It should make us uncomfortable to watch him push his daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The DOORBELL.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Again. Three times four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. You're adding again, you have to multiply. Three and four is seven. Three times four is...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twelve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three times five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you get that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (getting up; more about the answer than the door) Damn it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why can't I just use a calculator?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Three men: FELIX BARBOSA (whose photo we saw in Carver's office). Barbosa is a veteran of the coke business, but he's doing too much of the drug now; he's sweating, paranoid, unstable. With him is GOPHER, early 60s, a wizened high-voiced old con who Barbosa keeps the way Spanish kings kept dwarfs, for amusement and luck; like the court jester, Gopher can say anything he wants without fear. Behind them is an Hispanic kid, CHINO, 17, a thug. Elias knows them all, but is not happy to see them at his door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is very bad news. Elias murmurs a shaken, "Shit..." and steps outside, half-closing the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't realize until it's too late that Nancy has just then opened the front door to see where he went. They look at each other, a terrible moment: she knows what he does, hates it, can't bring herself to leave him, hates herself for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hands him a cordless phone, goes inside closing the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbosa laughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got a problem, David.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Call me on the phone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your friend Eddie just started bending over for the cops.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) They busted him, and he's dealing to save his ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which is how he'll lose the skinny little thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he give us up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not yet, but he will if he has to, and eventually he'll have to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Daddy! I thought we were doing my homework.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think he'd talk about us. He'd try not to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If we whack him, he definitely won't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Daddy!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Miranda) Just a second. (to Barbosa) Not yet. Let me check on this, first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taunting) Nobody said you had to do the dirty work, David. I'll take care of -- ELIAS Felix, if he's a problem, we'll kill him. I'll kill him myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Nancy, get out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For you; it's Eddie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got a tasty wife, David. No wonder you don't want us coming here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (warning him) Don't talk about her that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can't help it, David, it's his nature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone, chipper) Eddie... Sure, man, what do you need?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Elias joins Eddie and Hull to one side. In the b.g. two guys sparring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull makes a show of weary patience, gestures: here I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets up, walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: David, this is John, John, David. Eddie, this is Eddie. Everybody ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Elias) So what's this, you want to meet me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (charming, touch of mockery) I like to know the important customers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You're taking a lot of weight for a guy we hardly know. Where're you moving this stuff, John? We haven't seen you around. We like to have a sense who your customers are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, come on, man, do Macy's tell the Gimbel motherfuckers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat; watches him) Eddie, forget this guy, he's a cop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He's blown it. He's been made. The crushing failure. He rallies himself to indignation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie's sickened, wants to get paid, owes Taft a bust.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is this shit, Eddie? I thought you were the man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody's the fuckin' man. Go to your place. I'll call you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . A VAN - CONTINUOUS TIME Taft and Hernandez, watching the gym. Hull comes out, looks up and down the street carefully. Taft sits up, pays attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hernandez grunts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Taft clearly thinks there's something different about Hull. He's not sure what, but it troubles him. (NOTE: Hull makes a little move that Taft will later realize was a cop's move. For now he can't quite place it.)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is our collar?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Who is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some scumbag...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie pleading his case to Elias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias studies Eddie: is he a rat? Elias hopes not, but he's going to find out. He hands a fat Federal Express envelope through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie bows in gratitude, hurries off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's no cop, David. He's an animal. You see his eyes? You never see a cop with those eyes. I know this shit, man, you don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (giving him an opening) What's going on, Eddie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty-six thousand cash is what. We need it, David. We're behind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a warning) I want him to get it all, Eddie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hull's unlocking his door when Belinda, the hooker across the hall, comes out to talk. Her 6-year-old, James, watches, silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull slouches in the doorway, fingers to his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gives him another bill. The boy runs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull grunts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull is rescued from this horror by the ringing PAY PHONE. He runs down the hall, grabs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He dashes past Belinda into his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He closes the door, takes the money Carver gave him out from behind the mirror, dashes back outside. As he rushes by:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He keeps going. The Blonde Woman addresses Belinda.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (a crackhead) Mr. Hull... Mr. Hull...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wearily) What's happening, Belinda?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now you know, Mr. Hull, I was to the welfare this afternoon, but the bus, you know what I'm saying?... the one bus, and then the other, and when I got there they'd gone and changed the time on me, without notification. They's supposed to give notification, ain't they? They said I got a thing in the mail, but I don't remember, I don't think they sent it, so now I'm off the welfare, plus I forgot to take James for his shot... for the school? Which otherwise they let him go. And he's gotta learn, he's gotta learn, don't he, Mr. Hull, you tell him, so's he can better hisself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to James) You had any food today, James?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disclaiming any need) I had Ding-Dongs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs, gives him money) You go to the Mexican place over there, and get the chicken tostada or the beef and bean burrito or both. And a milk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't like milk. I want a -- HULL (an order) You get the milk! And get something for your mother, too. (to Belinda) What do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, Mr. Hull, if you just -- HULL (to James) Two tostadas, two burritos, two milks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You now, I look out for my James best I can, Mr. Hull, but it's hard. Now you like the boy, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I know you do. And I was thinkin' if you wanted to take care of him, that might be good for him. Give him a male figure to look up to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Belinda, I can't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you could just give me something for him. Say five thousand dollars... (off Hull's shock) Or maybe four thousand. I couldn't give up my boy for less than four thousand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's me. I'm here... Where?... five minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or you could just give me a part now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Let me do somethin' for you, Mr. Hull. Let me do a little somethin' for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No solicitin' in the halls. I told you that before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (spunkier than we've seen) I ain't doin' shit. Bitch...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A handful of customers under a mud sky. The THROB of a distant helicopter. Hull pulls into the lot beside Eddie's BMW. He climbs into the BMW, tosses Eddie a brown envelope; money spills onto his lap. Eddie does a quick count, produces the Fed Ex envelope. The usual white stuff. Hull's about to taste when the chopper swoops in with a sudden blinding overhead light. A BULLHORN booms down like the voice of God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie starts the car, and Hull rolls out the passenger door as the BMW races across the lot. Two black-and-whites and an unmarked converge on the stand. Hull can't reach his car. He vaults a metal rail and runs off between two buildings. Hernandez jumps out of an unmarked and races after him. Taft speeds the car out onto the street.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is the police. Remain inside the vehicle. Place your open hands against the windshield so that they are clearly visible...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Christ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a strategy) Spread the floor, Dudley. (rap sound effects with rhythmic head spasms) A-ga, a-ga, a-ga, a-ga...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: running. Police and SIRENS pursuing. He hurls the Fed Ex envelope into a dumpster. HELICOPTER light sweeps over him. As he cuts around a building, Taft opens a car door right into his face. Hull goes down hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He waves at the helicopter which goes away, kneels over Hull who is twitching spastically on the ground, gasping for air. Hernandez arrives carrying the Fed Ex envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull is astonished to look up and see Taft looming over him, the man he remembers from the videotape. He tries to speak:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull shakes head, winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull tries to curse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes out his wallet, opens it to pictures of his two children, a boy and a girl, seven and eight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull groans, twists in pain. Taft sticks the pictures in his face. Hull is affected by the children despite everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull just looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes the Fed Ex envelope from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taft yanks him hard to his feet; Hull cries out in pain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into car radio) Thank you kindly...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) How you doin', child?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (barely audible) You...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (briefly puzzled) Me? Of course, it's me. You know me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Hurts, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Here, I want to show you something. You have kids?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) These are mine. Aren't they the most beautiful children you ever saw?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Yeah, I know, they kind of leave you speechless. So let me ask, if someone put a gun to your baby's head, wouldn't you kill him if you could?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Me, too. And you're the bastard with the gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hoarse; his first words) You know the difference between a nigger and a black man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't jive me, boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The nigger's the one covers Whitey's ass by puttin' the brothers in jail.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ain't my brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hull is led in with other handcuffed PRISONERS. Carver is here, catches Hull's eye. Hull shakes his head; doesn't want Carver to intercede. A woman PUBLIC DEFENDER (26, attractive, harried) addresses the prisoners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull is listening to this when a BAILIFF taps his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puzzled, Hull sees the back of a suit conferring with a PROSECUTOR. The suit turns. It's DAVID ELIAS who smiles, offers his hand. Hull is stunned. Elias enjoys that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias addressing the court.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull is surprised at this news. The Judge looks to the Prosecutor who waives objection. Gavel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they walk toward the back, Taft approaches Hull. There's already a deep pull between these two, and in Taft's presence, Hull can't sustain the tough street act. We almost see the little boy inside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long look between them, broken when Elias takes Hull's arm, leads him away. Elias cheerfully greets a couple of hookers waiting arraignment. Hull furtively grabs his sleeve.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, I'm Shelley Weissbrod. This is only an arraignment, a preliminary hearing, but if you don't have money for an attorney, the Public Defender's office can...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got counsel. Over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a lawyer??
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm your lawyer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who hired you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) It's pro bono. If you don't want me, there's Shelley. She's good. She just can't provide special services...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (calling the next case) John Hull...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Getting your case called first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Your Honor, I believe the preliminary police toxicology report will show that the substance seized from my client was Mannitol, a baby laxative. We move for immediate dismissal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; to Hull) We're out of here, Dude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hull, amused) Baby laxative, they sold you some bad shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hull) You have a constipated baby, and you're in jail? What kind of a father are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A father who don't know his own children, ain't that right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (under his breath) You sold me Mannitol, motherfucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (under his) If it hadn't been, asshole, you'd be in jail right now... Come on, I want you to meet some people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: After hours. The place is closed. A couple of cars in the lot. Elias's BMW pulls in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deserted except for one table where Eddie, Barbosa, Gopher and Chino are eating shrimp. They look up as Hull and Elias approach. Eddie's astonished to see Hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie looks around, uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie looks around. Everybody's looking at him. He considers lying, but realizes it's pointless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull observes Barbosa become the power center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbosa's impassive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias looks stricken. Barbosa laughs. Eddie jumps up. Hull turns away, can't bear to watch this.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dudley, Dudley, Fo-Fudley...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Surprised to see him, Eddie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) John got busted and kept his mouth shut. Can't say that for everybody, can we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you saying? Are you saying me? Are you saying something about me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the truth, Eddie. Be honorable. It's all you got left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up, you little faggot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The cops made you give them somebody. We know it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, so what? I mean, so what, man? You got the money. Twenty-six G. Twenty-six, David. Count it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next time you might trade us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never. (turns to Barbosa) Never, Felix, never. Come on, man, you know I'd never...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) I know you never will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Felix, no. Don't be... I'm worth money to you. Let me give you money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? You don't owe me anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Another twenty-six grand... Just to show you... Fifty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not a hundred?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (that's so much) A hundred??? Felix...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Okay, a hundred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tomorrow. Twenty-four hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now. Ten seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Felix, I need time. I -- BARBOSA One... two...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have it right now. But I can -- GOPHER (sadly) Then goodbye, Eddie. I forgive you for what you said to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pleading) Twelve hours. Tomorrow morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Six... seven... (to Elias) You want to do it, David?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Nine...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: grabs the first thing he lays eyes on, a tiny snail fork and plunges it into Barbosa's neck. As if it were a fly bite, Barbosa flings the table aside and, with a long knife already in his hand, guts Eddie from groin to breast bone. Eddie falls like a suddenly emptied sack. Elias can't help gasping. Hull looks away, hiding his horror. Barbosa rips the fork out of his neck and hurls it at the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias stares at Eddie's body, transfixed. Horrified, fascinated, afraid, in awe. Barbosa turns to Hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone else is silent, grave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Piece of shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) What'd you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At least it was clean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pleased, to Elias) What about you, bar mitzvah body? First time you saw somebody die?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyes fixed on the body) No. (catching breath) At camp... when I was fourteen... a friend of mine was water skiing... The motorboat ran him over... A junior counsellor was driving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should kill a man some day, David, it's liberating... (walking out) Summer camp. I'm in business with somebody who went to summer camp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Through sliders we see a small pool. Elias and Hull sit over uneaten omelets. Both still shaken by the previous scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias puts a finger to his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull shrugs: he doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hear someone coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hugs her, kisses her, much more openly affectionate than Hull was with his own children. Hull notices that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias whispers in her ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miranda gives Hull a shy greeting. Nancy hurries into the kitchen, handsome, busy, ready for work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nancy nods briefly in Hull's direction. Elias kisses Miranda who grabs the back-pack her mother proffers, and they go out. When they're gone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When they're gone, he opens louvered doors onto a washer/dryer, takes a sports bag off a shelf, gives it to Hull. Hull looks inside. White powder. He tastes. Real. He hefts the bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias doesn't deny it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Eddie, man... He was always nice to my daughter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How'd a guy like you get into this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The way most drug lawyers do: clients paid me in product, and I had to move it. Soon I was doing more dealing than law. But this was '83, '84, there was so much money we thought it would never end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. And now...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The road gets rougher. Cocaine's a dying business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then what are we doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: People are always going to want to get high. Every society has ways to alter consciousness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because they can't bear reality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) We all need our delusions, only the means change: psychedelics, opiates, prayer, orgies, human sacrifice...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's next?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Why aren't you selling it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know how to make it and market it. But I need capital. That's the only reason I'm hanging out with an asshole like Barbosa. (feels his hatred of Barbosa) And because I can't get to the big guys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are the big guys?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gallegos, et cetera.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reacts to the name) Why can't you get to them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you care?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Anyway, designer drugs have a bad name: ice, ecstasy, tar -- there's a limited market for Parkinson's disease. But what about completely safe, almost legal, terrific shit you can go to work on and do your job better than you ever did it straight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sounds like a dream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (closing the subject) In dreams begin responsibilities.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me about this new shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some other time, John, when we know each other better. (as Miranda enters kitchen) Hey, bunnela. (she snuggles against him; Elias enjoys it) Five times two.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's too early. Don't bother me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; head in her father's chest) Seven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Oh, yeah... Ten... Who's he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's my friend, John. This is Miranda.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, Miranda.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, honey...

They're going straight at:

dialogue.raw_text: I'll give you money. I'll give you a million. Anything you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want you to get out of the car. Get out of the fucking car. Out of the fucking -- MCCUTCHEON (near tears) No, no... we can't do this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning around from front seat) Stop it, David, or we're...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in a fury) Look at my hands!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; to Barbosa, softly) Get out of the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddammit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stay out of this, or you'll die. You'll both die. Everyone'll die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Taft and Hull, the two drivers, lock eyes. It's chicken, but more than that. Two men set against each other who, for some reason, want to be friends. At the last instant, the van swerves away, but:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taft sees the gun too late. He can do nothing. Hull's gaze follows Taft's. He sees Elias, deliberately swerves, sending the SHOT wild.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The limo speeds away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You want to kill a cop?? Don't be stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LIMO - DRIVING - NIGHT The windows shot out. Hull and Betty silent, shaken. Elias charged up, happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's silent, keeps driving. She's had enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He brakes to a stop. She jumps out, leans back in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she disappears into the night. Elias watches her go. Hull resumes driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull accepts it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Everything is different. We're the Colombians now. (radiant) This is the greatest night of my life. Terrible but great. Felix was right...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (appalled) About what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said I should kill a man. He was right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Barbosa was a roach. Do you miss him? Will anybody in the world miss him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you a roach, too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (happily) Yes. Thank God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hull) What about you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Stop the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Stop it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) No more laundering, no more anything. I'm finished with this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She knows too much. We have to kill her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! She's with me. She's not going to talk. (looks at Elias) You touch her, I'll kill you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's your responsibility then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) We're going to get the money now, John. Enough for the new drug. We're going to be rich. We're going to be so rich that we're going to leave the world of ordinary people and going to a higher realm. I mean that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're going to come after us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (matter-of-fact) It's a hardball game. We're hardball players.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .A. - NIGHT Hernandez comes out of a bodega with groceries, wine and a woman. He nuzzles her as he lets her into his car. As he's getting behind the wheel, Molto (Gallegos' guard) stops the door from closing. The conversation is entirely in SPANISH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He SHOOTS him in the head. Hernandez slumps against the wheel. The woman screams. Molto walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't my fault.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It never is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BETTY'S APARTMENT - DAWN Hull finds a door, pushes the buzzer. Betty looks through the glass. She's afraid of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she looks closer and sees not murder in his face, but need. She opens the door. Without a word, he gathers her to him. She can't resist him now. Her mouth is everywhere on him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't kill me. I'm not going to talk. I swear. Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Betty gasping in the wake of pleasure, turning her face away from him, she feels so exposed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hides her face in his neck.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't look...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They lie in each other's arms, relaxed together for the first time. A wonderful, unprotected openness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He laughs. They begin to make love again. Suddenly: AN EXTRA HAND stroking Betty's hair. She gasps. A gun in Hull's ear. Another in her face. Guns all around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hands pull him out of bed, leave her there alone. We see Molto, two or three others.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Tell me about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (half-kidding) Everything worth knowing you just found you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't hurt her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: lays a bouquet of white lillies on a grave. He kneels, whispers a prayer, crosses himself. He rises and walks to where Molto and the other guards hold Hull and Elias. Gallegos is in his thirties, more European than Barbosa. He has a distinctly mild manner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An impudent question, but Elias seems strangely bright-eyed despite the guns held on him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who's grave?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My wife's. She died of leukemia three years ago. (looks around) I like to be among the dead. They never interrupt you. (turning to them) Felix Barbosa started out as a skinny fourteen-year-old fucking Yankee businessman in Bogata hotels. He grew up. He made himself strong and rich, but getting there made him sick, and that killed him. So he lost everything for the same reason he'd gotten it in the first place. Now we'll see if you can do as well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: going by greets Gallegos who responds warmly. They chat a minute in SPANISH. The Priest leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He addresses this to Hull; Elias feels left out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gallegos turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He notices Hull's earring: two tiny dice, the spots made of minuscule jewels. Unembarrassed, he fingers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without waiting for an answer, he yanks it out of Hull's ear and walks away, leaving Hull bleeding through his fingers before a stone cross.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Felix owed me one million eight hundred thousand dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) When you killed him, you bought the debt; now you owe it to me; you get to keep thirty percent, like he did. You have three days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who did Barbosa collect from?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you don't know, you shouldn't have killed him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Cute... Can I have that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A club on the corner. THROUGH A WINDOW we see a RAP ACT on the stage, their MUSIC pumping out onto the street. Hull pulls up in a Jaguar. He and Elias go through a door adjacent to the club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOPHER'S ROOM - NIGHT The MUSIC is still audible here, though muffled. Elias and Hull are pushing at door Gopher is trying to hold closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias kicks it open, and they enter Gopher's tiny, miserable domain. He's wearing some sort of negligee and an immense naked woman fills his bed. We still hear the MUFFLED MUSIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull pulls him off. Elias is angry. They struggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meaning: deal with me or deal with Elias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MUSIC continues OVER the following sequence:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want you in here. You killed the man, and I loved him. I don't want to have anything to do with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; apoplectic) I'm a sixty-three-year-old man! I'm a grandfather! Would you hit a sixty- three-year-old white man? Would you hit your own grandfather?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slaps him against wall) Listen, you fucking monkey, you know who owed him money, and we know you know. Tell us or --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll tell us. Gopher, just...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't tell anyone it was me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Elias arguing with a dealer. He slaps him around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Money is exchanged. The money is stuffed in a satchel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A well-dressed lawyer (30's) talking with clients, a distinguished couple in their 60's. The door BANGS open and a secretary is unable to restrain Hull and Elias as they charge into the room. The lawyer is up on his feet, but Hull shoves him around as Elias politely explains to the clients that this will only take a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull's hands thrust more money in. It's getting full.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A biker in leathers on hands-and-knees spitting blood onto the cement floor. Hull stands over him, fists clenched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A satchel stuffed with money is latched, set next to another latched one. A third is opened, money and jewelry dumped in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull looking into the trunk. Elias is beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias gets in the car and drives off. Hull turns and a dark American sedan pulls up alongside. Carver behind the wheel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where the hell is all the money? We're still a million short.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I gotta get laid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: David, we've got thirty-six hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slams trunk, moves toward door) Pick me up at Jacqueline's in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sooner than that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (an order) Get in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (as he gets in) What are you doing here? You're going to get me killed. Carver peels away fast. He's very angry, frightened, too, but that's hidden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an indifference to Carver's authority we haven't heard before. Hull isn't even aware of it, but Carver is.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where the hell have you been?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doing my job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You violated a direct order to stay away from that bust. As a result, a police informant is dead, a state senator was critically injured in the tunnel pile up and a city policeman was subsequently murdered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't blow my cover.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't get smart with me, motherfucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be a shmuck, Gerry. I'm talking to Gallegos. I'm collecting his money. We can set him up right now. (NOTE: Carver arrives somewhere and parks. To be discussed, but let's say, for now, that we are:)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They get out of the car. Carver takes out a flask, has a drink, offers it to Hull who declines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carver says nothing. Suddenly Hull understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carver snorts: ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surprised, Carver reaches for the flask. As he does, Hull grabs him, pushes him out over the edge of the building, holds him there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carver struggles. Hull pushes him out farther. Carver dangles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull pulls him back in. Carver slumps against the wall, drinks greedily. Hull lets him for a moment, then takes the flask away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slips the flask in his pocket, gets in the car, starts engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull drives off, leaving Carver alone on the roof.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Never have, never will. (puts the flask away) I want you to give me your gun. You're coming in right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (doesn't understand) Coming in where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your assignment has been terminated. You're not going out there again. If I have to, I'll put you in custody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uncomprehending) I'm going to have Gallegos in two days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You're protecting him. You're protecting Gallegos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) No, of course. That's why you wanted to bust Elias and Betty. I was getting close, and you wanted to cut this off then... What is he, the new Noriega? Helps you fight commies, so you let him sell drugs to the niggers. Two birds with one stone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You violated orders, so you're through. Don't make a conspiracy theory out of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) I'm through...? Then, I might as well have a drink after all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Now tell me the truth or they're going to decide your troubles got the best of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're insane.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All the more reason to do what I say. Jesus, Ger, I'm having trouble holding on...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's the State Department.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I told you, Gallegos's uncle is a big deal down there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guzman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guzman, right. Our government supports Guzman because he's a moderate. That's a right-winger who's pro-U.S. (he doesn't like it either) If Gallegos got busted here, it would hurt Guzman's political career there. It's politics, John, not drugs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drugs is politics. Politics is drugs... (sickened) Christ, Gerry, I dealt drugs. I killed a man. Others died. What did I do all this for? For nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to Washington, John. I'll bring you with me. We'll have clout, money...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (outraged) I didn't do this for clout or money. You said we were gonna do some good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We tried.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trying's for college boys. (his head on fire) If all there is is power and money... If all there is... then what am I doing here? 'Cause I can get more power and money out on the street, I got more there already, than I'd ever get kissing your ass in Washington...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you can't do that, John. It's not you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me? There is no me. We took care of that. First I was a cop pretending to be a dealer. Now I'm just a dealer pretending to be a cop. Why not stop pretending...? Quit the force. Be a dealer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not that simple.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My assignment's already terminated. All I have to do is quit. I hereby quit. (lifts the flask) My first one. (drinks) Not so bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't blow your cover.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She lets him in, sees the distress in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes his head, drops onto the couch. He takes out the flask, offers it to her. She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He laughs, takes a drink. She's surprised, says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The revelation is so sudden it surprises Hull as much as Betty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She holds him, and he lets himself be held.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulls playfully at her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods. He knows. He's even happy about it. But she won't yield. Finally he gets up and walks back out the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you, my mother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell you what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you came to say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did I come to say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then tell me anything. Something about you. Something real.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (long beat; another drink) When I was young, I occasionally stole things. (laughs to himself) My father died when I was ten. Right in front of me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Heart attack. He just fell down. He said, "I love you," then died in my arms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, baby...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Tell me what's going on, John?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (doesn't want to talk about that) You're not doing the stuff anymore, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Don't change the subject.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's hard. John...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to tell without telling) Things are getting, they're getting a little... confusing. I had certain plans, and people haven't come through exactly as they promised.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you expect with those people?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) It's not just those people. It's... it's bigger than that. It's of everybody. Present company excluded.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got to stop this, John, you know that. You gotta get out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course, you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (almost angry) No! This is what I'm supposed to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Supposed to? Who said you're supposed to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The whole fuckin' world. You think I didn't try something else? But everything funnels you right back here. Like it's where you had to go all along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you know what you're doing, don't you, selling this stuff? Doing to our own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I tried to get out now, they'd kill me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (tortured) I can't be with somebody's who involved in drugs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .M. The neighborhood is reminiscent of the one where Joe Stevens Sr. was killed. The rap club still pumps MUSIC onto the 4 A.M. streets where whores, junkies, children, teenagers with beepers and Nikes, welfare mothers roam as if it were daytime anywhere else. Their eyes, yearning, sullen, vital, hopeless and hoping stare at...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone knows what he is: the Black Man with the Big Car. They don't remember when he was just another hustler making street buys. Now they hate him, revere him, want to be him, not caring what it entails. Every eye follows as... He and Elias cross the street toward Gopher's door. Hull's eyes don't go right or left. He's a driven man now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gopher has just been roused from sleep. A light in his face, Hull and Elias looming over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull and Elias look at each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There've got to be more. We have a million two, we owe Gallegos one eight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you everyone. Everyone who owed him, everyone he... One eight? He's lying. Barbosa barely owed him a million.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Taft is showing her photocopies of phone bills, bank transactions, invoices. She's obviously upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She covers her face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I got every money transfer, every phone call, all your laundry tickets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (miserable) What do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John Hull.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or you'll go away 'til you're a dried up old woman, and when you come out, ain't nobody gonna want you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .A. STREET/INT. CAR - DAY Elias driving a car we haven't seen before and snickering to himself at some private joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias shakes his head: nothing. He laughs. They pull into the lot beside a movie theater.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you laughing at?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Technicolor Spanish melodrama is winding to its lurid end. A door in back opens, and a burst of daylight reveals Hull and Elias being brought in by a guard and met by Molto. Molto and the guard frisk them, take their guns and money satchels, make them wait a moment until... The movie ends. The house lights come on revealing Ramon Gallegos as the only spectator in the theater. He beckons. Molto and the guard bring Hull and Elias down the aisle to him. Gallegos looking in the satchels. A tense moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gallegos is stern for a moment, then laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody relaxes. Gallegos scribbles something on a piece of paper, hands it to the guard who feeds it into a fax machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias seems a bit mad, but no one minds. He and Hull are ready to go. He gestures to Molto, wants his gun back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gallegos gestures to Molto to give them the guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull looks at Elias; what's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He brings up the gun and SHOOTS Gallegos in the head. Hull and the guards are frozen. Then everyone goes for a gun. Elias SHOOTS the guard. Hull has his gun to Molto's head and screams at Elias:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meaning don't shoot him. But Elias has no intention of doing so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't believe it: the guy he's been after the whole time is dead on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molto nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It isn't one eight. (off Gallegos) It's a million one. That's all Barbosa owed, it's all we're paying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Big brass balls. Collecting money makes you strong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm telling our suppliers they got paid. They'll be very happy. I'm happy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And we're happy. Everybody's happy. It's a happy world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, how can I express my gratitude for a job well done?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We want Barbosa's business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Done. Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And, also, your business. All this. Your money, your dope, everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) You're tougher than I thought, but not that tough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How tough is enough?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breathless) Thank you, John. I couldn't have done that without you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (barely able to speak) Jesus Christ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You taught me to take my work seriously.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's going on here, David?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're taking over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're doing too much stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm very clear. I'm very, very clear. (to Molto) Ahora, usted nos assistamos. Enteindo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CAR - DAY Hull, Elias and Molto getting into their car. Molto is recalcitrant. Elias pistol whips him. Hull stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR - DAY The car passes through a development of suburban homes. They enter a driveway. Two boys play in the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molto is silent. Elias FIRES a bullet right between his feet. Molto jumps. The boys turn. Hull grabs the gun away. We feel the toll Elias's madness is taking on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, indeed, Molto is pointing to a Winnebago parked at the rear of the property.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Molto) Donde esta?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck's the matter with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It works, John. It works.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Winnebago. With a tire iron, Hull snaps off the padlock that holds the rear door closed. He opens the door. Money gushes out. He slams it closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He, Elias and Molto are on hands and knees scooping it up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Molto tied to a tree. Elias is giving him instructions while, strangely, removing Molto's shoes and socks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molto just glares at him. Elias smiles, takes the shoes and socks and all the contents of Molto's into the Winnebago, and he and Hull drive away, leaving the car behind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Molto) Disce a Senor Guzman que... (his Spanish isn't good enough) ...that we have his money, and we're willing to talk as soon as he comes to town. We'll know how to reach him. Okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . WINNEBAGO - EVENING The Winnebago enters the garage, Elias greeting the attendant, "Hey, Frank." Frank waves him in. The garage is filled with various RVs. Hull pulls the Winnebago into an empty spot beside Elias's car and gets out. Elias remains in the cabin making calculations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he does, Hull checks his gun, walks around behind the vehicle and prepares to shoot Elias in the back of the head through the open window. Elias finishes his money report, and sits there as if unaware of Hull, but:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull uncocks the gun, rubs it against his burning face. Elias turns around, embraces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Approximating the cubic capacity and depending on the denominations of the bills, it's somewhere between fifty million and two hundred million dollars. Right back there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; not turning around) Think I'm crazy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. (blowing up, gun still on him) I can't believe you got us into this. All of fucking Latin America is going to be after our asses, including Renaldo Guzman who's friends with fucking George Bush.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know they're coming after us. I want them to. We'll give them the money, but we'll make a deal for ourselves. We'll get what we need for the synthetic drugs. I've thought it all out. I've been thinking it out for years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) We're going to have everything. Don't you want everything, John?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're going to get your family, David. They'll kill your wife and daughter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (serene) Nancy and Miranda left the country two days ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You knew about this then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) What about Betty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A car SQUEALS to a stop. Molto and three thugs smash through the glass door. They disappear into the store where things can be heard BREAKING. They emerge a moment later, jump into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull's car races up. He jumps out, dashes toward the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forty PEOPLE on folding chairs. Hull enters on a dead run. He stops short when he sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the front. He signals to her, but she's already saying:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room bursts into APPLAUSE. She sees Hull at the back; he signals to her, but she goes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's looking right at Hull as she speaks. He's torn between the danger he knows she's in and his emotion at what she's saying.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, my name is Betty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, Betty!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My name is Betty, I'm a drug addict. And I've been clean for nineteen days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I've been using drugs and selling them, and I've wanted to stop for a long time, and the only way I did was because I met a man I loved and who loved me. I know that's not what I'm supposed to say. I'm supposed to say there was a higher power, and maybe there was, behind it all, but this man is strong and his love made me strong enough that I could start, or at least think about a life that didn't have drugs in it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hull hurrying Betty toward his car. She's protesting.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've got to get clothes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't go back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Molto and men pouring through it. In frustration, Molto smashes the table Hull had fussed over when Elias put his feet up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull and Betty hurry toward his room carrying shopping bags, a newly bought suitcase. They see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They freeze, turn, ready to bolt. But more cops behind them. A panic, yet no one's coming after them. They walk on. The cops are going into and coming out of Belinda's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fat Blonde Woman is talking to a policewoman. James sits on the bed staring at...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who lies dead on a floor littered with crack vials. Hull picks up a vial, holds it up to the Blonde Woman with a question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy allows himself to be led out. Betty looks at Hull who's in a private hell.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding) She got a fever and just burned up. She just burned up all of a sudden. It must have been bad stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating James) He shouldn't be here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (takes his hand) Come on, James, we'll go get a burrito.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hull and Betty are about to enter Hull's room. The door is ajar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taft stands at the dresser. He's found Hull's collection of memorabilia and is looking at the photo of his children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He snatches away the photo, but not before Betty sees it. She reaches out her hand. He reluctantly turns it over to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull doesn't answer, collects the rest of his things, including the bloody money, stuffs it back in the envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leaves. Hull turns to Betty who is still holding the photo of his children. He gently takes it, looks at it, seems to draw both succor and pain from it. He gets out Carver's flask and tries to drink, but it's empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull's upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He empties his pockets of all that gushed out of the Winnebago, empties a satchel as well until it fills the room like snow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cute kids...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angry at the invasion) Give me that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me something, who the fuck are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) 'Cause I don't think you're quite the asshole you're trying to be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Mr. Taft, that's your name, right? Leave me alone. I got things on my mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd think you would. You better have your goddamn life on your mind, or it's gonna get away from you. It's gonna burn up like that poor woman across the way. Like all of you's gonna burn...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what do you do, Mr. Taft, except chase bad guys up and down the street with your dirty partner, never catching anybody important?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do what I can. Do you do what you can? (Hull says nothing) Maybe my partner was dirty. Maybe the chief's dirty. And the mayor. And the President. Maybe God Himself's taking something on the side. That's their problem. But I'll bust 'em if I can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (without force) Get out of my room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't deny who you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're my children. They live in Cleveland with their mother. I'm divorced from her. I haven't seen them in... some time. I want to, but I haven't been able to arrange it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much else don't I know about you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to make a joke) Everything else... Everything else is... I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Taft has all the evidence about my laundering.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's going to put me in jail for a long time unless I give you up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't. So, I've got to get away. Far away. But I need money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) Money? I got money...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hull putting Betty into an airport limousine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She kisses him. He's about to close the door. She stops it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This news startles Hull, yet, strangely, he senses its truth, and the sweetness is more than he can bear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She closes the door. The car pulls away. In an unmarked car up the street, Taft picks up the radio.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to the driver) International terminal. (to Betty) I'll meet you there in a week.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know the first time, when I saw you in the bar...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles at the memory) You wouldn't even look at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Cause I knew what you were thinking. You were judging me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I wasn't, I was...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were. Your eyes were like an angel in my heart telling me I should be good, and I didn't want to hear it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) That's you, too. Maybe this is you, I don't know, but I know that's you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A limousine pulls into the gate and disgorges RENALDO GUZMAN, 55, and his wife, 25. They're shown into the consulate. The limousine pulls out onto the street and parks. Gopher appears, knocks on the driver's window. It comes down. They chat briefly in Spanish. Gopher opens up a cellular phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Overlooking the ocean. Hull pacing nervously, Elias relaxed, reading the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A phone RINGS. Elias picks up his own cellular.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What if we forget all this? Take ten million each and disappear. Leave the country. New identities, new lives...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter, John? Having doubts?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... Where?... No! No way... We pick the time and place... Otherwise no meet... (looks to Hull who nods his agreement) Got a pencil?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gopher hands a piece of paper to the limo driver. He walks away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he's about to get into a car, Taft grabs him. Gopher is surprised and not pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where Hull and Elias left the Winnebago. Guzman's limo approaches. Frank, the attendant, waves it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The limo climbs the ramps until it comes to Elias's car, parked where the Winnebago was; the Winnie is nowhere in sight. The limo pulls alongside. Hull and Elias get out. Molto gets out of the limo. Then Renaldo Guzman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guzman waves: get to the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands a copy to Guzman and the lawyer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We have a proposal to make. We regret what happened to your nephew...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say what you have to say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We all know that your cousin's business is coming to an end. Costs have climbed while profits and the market --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) We have developed a new product: simpler, cheaper to manufacture, superior quality and completely synthetic. Therefore, no growing, no refining, no peasants, no importing, no customs agents... Here's a detailed prospectus with anticipated cash flow and so forth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Molto, teasing Elias) The racist Americans just want to cut us poor Hispanics out of the market.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are no Americans anymore, Mr. Guzman, you know that. No Hispanics, no Japanese, no blacks, no whites, no anything. There are only rich people and poor people. We're rich, so we're on the same side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Taft with Gopher in his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gopher shrugs; a decision: Taft picks up his radio.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do they have money in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They wouldn't meet here otherwise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Okay, everybody, here's the play...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We're prepared to give you 80% of the money. The remainder you invest in our business with proceeds paid out according to the figures there. He indicates the prospectus that Guzman has been looking through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias produces one. Guzman gestures to Molto. Molto samples it. Molto's eyes widen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elias hands him a key, points to a different Winnebago. Molto takes the key, unlocks the back: money. He signals okay to Guzman. Suddenly: SIRENS. Police cars wail into the garage. The THWACK- THWACK and sweeping light of a helicopter descend toward the roof (though we never see the copter).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody scatters. The garage is a labyrinth of cement stairwells, ramps, hundreds of RVs to hide between, under and so forth... Lots of NOISE, lights, but mostly we see Hull and Elias dodging here, avoiding the action.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This looks interesting. I'd have to confirm everything, of course. Do you have a sample of the product?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Buy it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is our money?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; anger) You set this up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're after us, not you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Molto caught between the lights. He draws his gun. GUNFIRE. He's cut down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming) Where are the rest of them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cars with rotating dome lights, but not many cops. Hull and Elias emerge from a shadowy doorway and make their way at a casual pace beyond the perimeter of police cars, quickly mingling with other spectators. They continue down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strolling now. Elias elated, uncontained joy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull stops walking and just stands there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In one motion, Elias draws his gun, turns and FIRES. The figure goes down. Elias can't believe he hit him. Hull starts toward the figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taft -- on the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drops to his knees. Blood oozes from Taft's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull tries to hold closed the wound. The posture duplicates Hull with his dying father. He feels for a pulse. For breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls at Hull who won't go. Hull does mouth-to-mouth. Taft opens his eyes, looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taft grunts once, stiffens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pulse is gone. Hull begins to perform CPR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull keeps doing CPR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull keeps working on Taft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts a gun to Taft's head and FIRES. In a reflex, Hull draws his own gun, SHOOTS Elias in the stomach. Stunned, he wobbles backward a few steps. Sits on the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull is stunned he did it. And this finally attracts the police who see a black man with a gun who just shot a white man. Hull goes to Elias who's dead. A POLICEMAN pulls him off, beating him with a gun.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We did it. Twenty million. Twenty fucking million. We're going to have synthetics. We're gonna be rich. We're gonna...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) What's the matter, John? Be happy. Your whole life has just been solved.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (behind them) Stop! Police!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (heading the other way) John, where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Jesus, no...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John, what the hell are you doing? Let's get out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (distraught) He's dying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let him die. Let him die twice. Come one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: [Says to Taft whatever a CPR-trained policeman would say in this situation.] (to Elias) Get help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you kidding me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hull, getting it) Oh, man, you're a cop. You're a cop, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with difficulty, as if against his will) Yeah, I'm a cop. I'm a fucking cop...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) Oh, really? Where's you badge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have one. I'm undercover. Get help, David.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John, that's a cop. He tried to kill you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He didn't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, he didn't know. I don't know. Maybe you don't know. Maybe you think you're a cop because... because...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drop the gun, put your hands against the car. Spread your legs... Police!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) My God! Please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, let's say you're a cop. Be a cop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) We've still got the money. We put it into Randy's chemistry set. In five years we're worth five hundred million each, minimum. You'll be one of the richest black men in America. Richer than Cosby. Who gives a shit how you got it? You think the white ones were honest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Is this asshole all that stands between you and greatness? Let me do you a favor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Gee, John, that's kind of an extreme reaction.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fucking nigger...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hull, bandaged, wearing prison blues, walking with Carver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull looks at him; how did he know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He beckons him. He walks him over to a cell. Through a one- way window they see:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What about Guzman?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He vanished, thank God, or we'd both be in deep doo-doo. At least you got Gallegos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Elias did. And everything goes on as before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the drug game. Plus a change... I want you to come back to work for me. You'll beat all charges on a technicality and go back to who you were.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who was I, Ger?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does anyone really know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have other things to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like travel? Tangiers, maybe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I'm God, remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: alone in the cell, unaware she's being watched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hull just looks at him. Carver shrugs apologetically.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Go back to work, she walks out of here. Otherwise, she's up on multiple counts, and I'll see to it the judge runs them consecutively.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Absolutely white. Not a window, not a stick of furniture. The only deviation is Hull in prison blues. The door opens, Betty comes in wearing prison yellows. She sits on a nearly invisible chair. They know they're being watched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shakes her head in cynical understanding. How difficult it is to get back to an honorable life. He takes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They want me to testify against you. I said I wouldn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have to. It's all set up. That's how you're getting off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; with difficulty) My father didn't have a heart attack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) He was shot robbing a liquor store. Trying to rob it. I lied about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Baby, why are you telling me this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had to start somewhere... There're other things you don't know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Silent. Kissing. Beginning to make love. Hull extracts himself, gives the finger to the POV and stuffs a bit of tissue in the iris, blocking our view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carver takes his eye from the now obscured peephole.
direction.name: direction
